title: Miami private school asks teachers not to get vaccinated
description: A Miami private school has forbidden its employees to get the Covid-19 vaccine, and if they do, they will not be allowed to return, the school told its staff. CNN's Leyla Santiago reports.

title: Critics of Gov. Newsom gather enough signatures to force recall election
description: Critics of California Gov. Gavin Newsom have met the state's threshold with enough validated signatures to force a recall election of the Democratic governor this year, a contest that could land on the ballot as early as this summer or as late as December.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro faces government probe into his handling of Covid-19
description: Brazil's Senate launched an inquiry Tuesday into the federal government's response to Covid-19, which could hobble President Jair Bolsonaro's re-election bid if it leads to an impeachment proceeding or criminal charges.

title: Britney Spears to address court at upcoming conservatorship hearing
description: Britney Spears will address the court at an upcoming conservatorship hearing.

title: Why leaked tape of top Iranian official is a big deal
description: Karim Sadjadpour explains the significance of a leaked audio tape where Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif speaks out about Gen. Qasem Soleimani and criticizes Russia's actions in the nuclear deal negotiations.

title: Republican officials peddle false Kamala Harris story based on one photo
description: CNN's Daniel Dale debunks a false story issued by the New York Post claiming Vice President Kamala Harris' children's book was distributed in "welcome kits" to young migrants at a shelter in Long Beach, California.

title: New poll reveals how Americans feel about Chauvin verdict
description: CNN's David Chalian goes over a new CNN poll that reveals how Americans feel about police reform after the guilty verdict in the trial of former police officer Derek Chauvin for the murder of George Floyd.

title: Iranian attack boats harassed US warships in Persian Gulf again on Monday, Navy says
description: Iran's Navy once again harassed US ships operating in the Persian Gulf, this time coming within 68 yards of the ships on Monday night, prompting one of the American ships to fire warning shots, according to Cdr. Rebecca Rebarich, a spokeswoman for the US Navy's Fifth Fleet.

title: Beavers chewed through a cable and knocked out internet service to hundreds in a Canadian town
description: A colony of beavers gnawed through a fiber optic cable near their dam over the weekend, disrupting internet service for hundreds of residents in Western Canada

title: Abby Phillip discusses divide in the GOP between Hawley, McCarthy and Cheney
description: CNN's Abby Phillip discusses the divide in the Republican Party between Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) and other conservatives like House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) and Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO).

title: The teens at the center of the fight over transgender athletes' rights
description: A wave of bills restricting transgender athletes are being considered in 2021. Again and again, supporters point to one case in Connecticut at the center of a political battle over transgender rights. For more, watch "United Shades of America" Sunday at 10 p.m. ET/PT.

title: Biden speech: New mask guidance a great reason to go get vaccinated
description: President Joe Biden cited new guidance from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention -- which said vaccinated Americans do not have to wear masks outside in some situations -- to urge all Americans to go get a vaccine.

title: Rupert Murdoch abandons plans to shake up UK television news landscape
description: Rupert Murdoch has officially scrapped plans to launch a TV news channel in the United Kingdom.

title: Boris Johnson denies disrespecting Covid-19 victims. But the political crises are piling up.
description: It was only two weeks ago that Boris Johnson looked set for a triumphant spring, as the UK's rapid vaccine rollout meant his country could put the nightmare of the past year-and-a-half behind it.

title: The true extent of the second wave now ravaging India is likely much worse than official numbers suggest
description: India, home to the world's worst ongoing coronavirus outbreak, has reported more than 17.6 million cases since the pandemic began last year.

title: Julian Nagelsmann, 33, to become new Bayern Munich coach
description: RB Leipzig's Julian Nagelsmann will take over from Hansi Flick as Bayern Munich's head coach next season after signing a five-year contract, the Bundesliga champion announced on Tuesday.

title: Lebanon battles swarms of locusts after wind changes direction
description: Army helicopters are spraying agricultural land in northeast Lebanon to help farmers battle swarms of locusts that flew to the country in what a United Nations agency said was a "very rare" event caused by a change in the wind direction.

title: Arizona secretary of state on GOP election audit: 'This seems like such a farce'
description: Arizona Secretary of State Katie Hobbs on Monday criticized the ongoing Republican election audit of the 2020 ballots from Arizona's largest county as a political stunt, calling it a "farce" and saying it should end.

title: Israel accused of apartheid by Human Rights Watch
description: Human Rights Watch has accused the Israeli government of committing crimes of apartheid and persecution against Palestinians in a new report Tuesday, eliciting an angry response from Israeli officials.

title: The Trump Republican circus gears up for another tour
description: Donald Trump schooled his protégés well in his politics of down-in-the-muck misinformation.

title: Italian hermit on island alone is leaving after 32 years
description: He's become known as Italy's Robinson Crusoe after spending more than 30 years as the only resident of an idyllic island off the coast of Sardinia.

title: Wall Street's losses on Archegos just topped $10 billion
description: Losses caused by the collapse of US hedge fund Archegos have topped $10 billion.

title: How surfer overcame a life-threatening accident to surf two record-breaking waves
description: As Maya Gabeira carves a white ripple across the face of a 73-foot wave, two thoughts flash through her mind.

title: EU chief says Turkey chair snub happened 'because I am a woman'
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has said sexism was to blame for an incident where she was left awkwardly standing while her male colleague sat during her last visit to Turkey earlier this month.

title: Titanium bubbles discovered in supernova could help solve mystery of exploding stars
description: Titanium has been discovered in the beautiful remnants of the Cassiopeia A supernova about 11,000 light-years away.

title: Experts say Covid cases and deaths are going unreported in India despite soaring numbers
Amputee's application to compete with running blades rejected
description: World Athletics have rejected an application from American double amputee Blake Leeper to run on particular running specific prostheses (RSPs), preventing him from competing in the Olympics or World Athletics events.

title: What women should know about the Johnson & Johnson coronavirus vaccine
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the US Food and Drug Administration lifted the pause on the Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine on Friday. The agencies previously had decided to pause administration of the vaccine due to cases of an extremely rare blood clotting disorder found in six women between the ages of 18 and 49 who had gotten the shot.

title: How you and your kids can avoid Covid-19 at playgrounds
description: Playgrounds seem like -- and in many cases are -- a relatively safe pandemic activity, but there are factors that can complicate the issue.

title: Tesla cracks the $1 billion profit mark
description: Tesla posted record profits Monday — its third record quarter in a row — as its adjusted earnings reached the $1 billion mark for the first time.

title: The 'anonymous' South African artist turning dreams into reality through photography and AR
description: For the artist known as Xopher Wallace, it all started with a recurring dream he had as a child.

title: I felt hurt: EU chief slams sexist treatment in Turkey
description: • EU chief says sexism to blame for incident

title: Meet the architect building the world's tallest hotel
description: If you look out onto the Dubai skyline, you're likely to be admiring the work of Yahya Jan.

title: Britain is sending a huge naval force through some of the most tense waters in Asia
description: The largest naval flotilla assembled by Britain in recent years will set sail in May on a months' long voyage through the Pacific, the country's Defense Ministry said Monday.

title: Kidnappers kill two more abducted students
description: Two students who were kidnapped from a university in northern Nigeria last Tuesday have been killed, making it a total of five Greenfield University students killed by their abductors, an official said in a statement released Monday.

title: Emergency declared as Arizona wildfire grows to 1,400 acres
description: Officials declared a county emergency for the Flag Fire in Arizona after it grew from 600 to 1,400 acres Monday, according to the latest information from the Bureau of Land Management.

title: Calls grow louder for police to release bodycam video six days after shooting of Andrew Brown Jr.
description: Six days after Andrew Brown Jr. was fatally shot by police, protesters gathered again Monday to call for the release of the body camera footage they hope will answer questions surrounding his death.

title: China targets foreign spies and 'hostile forces' with new anti-espionage rules
description: China is stepping up anti-espionage activities amid worsening ties with the United States and a renewed focus on national security ahead of a key Communist Party anniversary later this year.

title: The couple who met on the beach at Byron Bay
description: It was a summer's day in Byron Bay, Australia in early 2003. The sun was shining and Gianna Mazzeo, who'd been basking in its rays for most of the day, decided to freshen up with a swim.

title: What to know about India's worsening Covid crisis
description: In February, it seemed like India had gotten Covid-19 under control, with daily cases falling nearly 90% from the peak of the first wave last year.

title: Heartbreaking scenes in Delhi's crematorium and hospital amid brutal second wave
description: CNN's Vedika Sud goes to New Delhi's crematorium and hospital, which have been crippled by India's record-breaking second wave of Covid-19 cases.

title: Anderson gets emotional ahead of his son's first birthday
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects one year after announcing the birth of his son, Wyatt. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Thursday and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: He promised to turn dirt into gold. He got millions of dollars -- and prison time
description: A Utah man promised investors his business could turn dirt into gold and swindled millions of dollars from them over several years, according to federal officials. Now, he has been sentenced to prison for his role in an $8 million telemarketing fraud scheme.

title: Alaska Airlines bans state lawmaker for her 'continued refusal to comply' with mask mandate
description: An Alaska state lawmaker who had called flight attendants "mask bullies" and clashed with airline employees on video over mask rules is now banned from Alaska Airlines for her "continued refusal to comply" with the mask policy, the airline said in a statement.

title: CNN obtains video taken after Andrew Brown Jr. was shot
description: CNN has obtained video of the immediate aftermath of the fatal shooting of Andrew Brown Jr., who was fatally shot by Pasquotank County sheriff's deputies in Elizabeth City when they attempted to serve him with an arrest warrant, the sheriff's office said.

title: Lawyers arguing for Capitol rioter's release say he called Pelosi 'biatch,' which is 'less offensive'
description: Lawyers for a man photographed sitting at a desk in House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's office during the January 6 riot at the US Capitol are arguing that he called her a "biatch," not a "b*tch," in calling for his release.

title: California governor to face recall election
description: Critics of California Gov. Gavin Newsom have met the state's threshold with enough validated signatures to force a recall election of the Democratic governor this year, a contest that could land on the ballot as early as this summer and as late as December.

title: Obama 'appalled by heartbreaking violence' in Myanmar
description: Former President Barack Obama issued a statement on Monday condemning the military coup in Myanmar.

title: Kamala Harris announces US will send $310 million in humanitarian aid to Central America
description: Vice President Kamala Harris announced Monday evening that the US will send an additional $310 million to Central America "for humanitarian relief and to address food insecurity."

title: Stranger drives over 600 miles to fulfill Santa wish list tied to a balloon
description: After finding a Christmas wish list tied to a balloon, Alvin Bamburg drove hundreds of miles to make 4-year-old twins Luna and Gianella's wishes come true. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 6p E.T.
